column4: I have tried to install three different Windows PC-games on ubuntu. None of them will work. Here is the erros for one of them: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/38780/
most games doesnt work at all. check the list of compatible applications on winehq, and perhaps considder cedega
all three games are listed on wine hqs homepage
yes, but with what levelof functionality, and installed using what method?
what do you mean? here is one of the games I try run with wine (installing worked fine): http://appdb.winehq.org/appview.php?iAppId=3892
http://appdb.winehq.org/appview.php?iVersionId=5977
see, that game isnt supported :)
'installs'='yes', 'runs'='no', 'rating'='garbage' :)
why dont you try .9.28?
'sudo apt-get install wine' for upgrading?
add the winehq repo first
http://www.winehq.org/site/download-deb
when youve added the repo, do sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install wine
please pay attention
thats because of copyprotection
as i said, very few games actualy work. check out cedega, but your best bet is a dual boot
my last awnser is still valid. stop trying :) you just get your head hurt from banging it to the wall
but you are using an ages old version of wine. update!
I just did, wine-0.9.28
have you done the winecfg thing?
then a regerssion bug might be in order. as i said, gaming under wine isnt very functional, at all
